IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WE ARE COMMITTED TO ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE BY NURTURING INDIVIDUALITY, INDEPENDENCE, VALUES, AND COMMUNITY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: MEADOWLARK HILLS IS EACH RESIDENT'S HOME. WE ARE COMMITTED TO ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE BY NURTURING INDIVIDUALITY, INDEPENDENCE, VALUES, AND COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: HEALTH CARE: FOLLOWING MEADOWLARK'S NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED HOUSEHOLD MODEL, THESE HOUSES ARE DESIGNED TO OFFER THE FREEDOM, PRIVACY AND CONNECTIVITY OF HOME TO RESIDENTS WHO NEED ROUND-THE-CLOCK SKILLED NURSING CARE. OF THE 133 LICENSED BEDS, APPROXIMATELY 42% ARE OCCUPIED BY RESIDENTS RECEIVING MEDICAID BENEFITS, 7% RECEIVING MEDICARE A BENEFITS AND 51% PRIVATE PAY. TOTAL OCCUPANCY FOR FY23 WAS 92.0%.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: INDEPENDENT LIVING: INDEPENDENT LIVING OPTIONS RANGE FROM SPACIOUS COTTAGES WITH ROOM FOR OUTDOOR ENTERTAINING TO A STUDIO APARTMENT. FOR FY23, 167 APARTMENTS AND DUPLEXES WERE AVAILABLE AND HAD A TOTAL OCCUPANCY OF 90.5%.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: HOME HEALTH: MEADOWLARK'S HOME HEALTH SERVICES ALLOW YOU TO RECEIVE QUALITY MEDICAL CARE WHILE MAINTAINING THE GREATEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE POSSIBLE. NURSES AND HOME HEALTH AIDES CAN ADDRESS YOUR HEALTH ISSUES IN THE COMFORT OF YOUR OWN HOME. THE ORGANIZATION OPERATES AN 8-BED HOME PLUS ASSISTED LIVING AND MEMORY CARE FACILITIES. THESE FACILITIES FOCUS ON PROVIDING INDIVIDUALIZED CARE FOR SENIORS WITH DEMENTIA OR SOME FORM OF MEMORY LOSS IN A HOME SETTING. TOTAL OCCUPANCY FOR FY23 WAS 87.3%

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ASSISTED LIVING: IN MEADOWLARK'S ASSISTED LIVING HOUSEHOLDS, TYPICAL CHORES SUCH AS HOUSEKEEPING AND LINEN SERVICE ARE TAKEN CARE OF SO YOU CAN ENJOY YOURSELF AND YOUR TIME. MEANWHILE, AROUND-THE-CLOCK STAFF GIVES YOU AND YOUR FAMILY PEACE OF MIND, ALLOWING YOU TO MAINTAIN BOTH YOUR SAFETY AND QUALITY OF LIFE. FOR FY23, 38 ASSISTED LIVING APARTMENTS WITH 46 LICENSED BEDS WERE AVAILABLE. TOTAL OCCUPANCY FOR THE YEAR WAS 96.4%.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS TRUSTEE OF VARIOUS RESIDENT FUNDS AND HAS A FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE ADMINISTRATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF THESE FUNDS FOR THE RESIDENTS. THESE FUNDS ARE ON DEPOSIT IN A SEPARATE BANK ACCOUNT.

THE ORGANIZATION'S INCOME TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY ACTIVITIES THAT WOULD JEOPARDIZE ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY ACTIVITIES THAT ARE SUBJECT TO TAX ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME OR EXCISE OR OTHER TAXES.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO FUND CONSTRUCTION OF NEW INDEPENDENT LIVING BUILDING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, BOND A, PART I, COLUMN F
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REFUND SERIES 2016 BONDS ISSUED 6/9/16, 2017 BONDS ISSUED 12/13/17, AND 2019 REVENUE BONDS BONDS ISSUED 12/20/2019. ALSO, A PORTION WAS USED TO REFUND A PRIOR OUTSTANDING CONSTRUCTION LOAN; MAKE PAYMENTS TO TERMINATE THE SWAP AGREEMENT ISSUED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SERIES 2016A BONDS, PAY COSTS OF ACQUIRING, CONSTRUCTING AND RENOVATING PROJECTS, FUND THE MASTER RESERVE FUND, AND PAY CERTAIN ISSUANCE COSTS OF THE SERIES 2021 BONDS.
ALTHOUGH FINAL ALLOCATIONS HAVE NOT BEEN MADE, THE ORGANIZATION WILL MAINTAIN ADEQUATE BOOKS AND RECORDS TO SUPPORT THE ALLOCATION, ONCE MADE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, BOND B, PART I COLUMN E, AND PART II LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ISSUE PRICE AND TOTAL PROCEEDS OF ISSUE DIFFER AS A RESULT OF INVESTMENT EARNINGS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL BE A STANDING COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES: 1. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL CONSIST OF ALL ELECTED OFFICERS AND ANY OTHER TRUSTEE ELECTED THERETO BY THE BOARD. 2. THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES SHALL SERVE AS CHAIR OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. IN THE ABSENCE OF THE CHAIR, THE VICE CHAIR SHALL SERVICE AS CHAIR. 3. THE SECRETARY SHALL SERVE AS SECRETARY OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. 4. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE POWER AND AUTHORITY BETWEEN MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, TO TRANSACT ANY AND ALL BUSINESS WHICH THE BOARD MAY DIRECT IT TO TRANSACT, OR WHICH MAY BE NECESSARY FOR THE PROPER CONDUCT AND OPERATION OF THE BUSINESS OF THE MANHATTAN RETIREMENT FOUNDATION, INC. DURING SAID INTERIM, EXCEPT THAT DECISIONS INVOLVING $50,000 OR MORE REGARDING ANY NON-EMERGENCY IMPROVEMENT OR REFINANCING SHALL BE RESERVED FOR THE ENTIRE BOARD. 5. A QUORUM FOR TRANSACTIONS OF BUSINESS SHALL BE THREE-FOURTHS OF THE MEMBERS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. 6. MEETINGS OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WILL NORMALLY BE CLOSED UNLESS OTHERWISE DESIGNATED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. OPEN MEETINGS MAY BE ATTENDED BY ANY MEMBER(S) OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, BUT HE/SHE MAY NOT VOTE ON COMMITTEE ACTION. ANY TRUSTEE PRESENT WHO IS NOT AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEMBER SHALL HAVE THE PRIVILEGE OF ENTERING INTO THE DISCUSSION. 7. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL EVALUATE THE PRESIDENT/CEO ANNUALLY, AND REPORT TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. 8. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL RECOMMEND NEW MEMBERS FOR THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND PRESENT NOMINATIONS FOR CHAIR, VICE CHAIR, SECRETARY, AND TREASURER AT THE MAY MEETING OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. 9. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL REVIEW THE BY-LAWS AND RECOMMEND APPROPRIATE AMENDMENTS. 10. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE TO DEVELOP FISCALLY-RESPONSIBLE POLICIES REGARDING RESIDENCY QUALIFICATIONS. 11. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL REVIEW AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REGARDING THE POLICIES FOR APPROVING INDEPENDENT LIVING RESIDENCY APPLICATIONS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DRAFT COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING. A FINAL COPY IS ALSO PROVIDED UPON FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES ARE ASKED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. IF A BOARD MEMBER OR EMPLOYEE INVOLVED IN MAKING DECISIONS ON BEHALF OF THE ORGANIZATION IS DETERMINED TO HAVE A CONFLICT, THEY DO NOT PARTICIPATE IN DECISIONS REGARDING BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS WITH THE PARTY IN INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROCESS OF DETERMINING COMPENSATION BY AN INDEPENDENT PARTY WAS FOLLOWED FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER. COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS ARE DETERMINED BY USE OF AN INDEPENDENT PERSONNEL COMMITTEE, COMPENSATION SURVEY AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST PERFORMED IN 2022. THE CEO DETERMINES COMPENSATION OF OTHER KEY EMPLOYEES IN THE ORGANIZATION. THE DELIBERATION AND DECISIONS ARE SUBSTANIATED THROUGH EMPLOYEE EVALUATIONS AND EMPLOYEE DATA SHEETS. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST PERFORMED IN APRIL OF 2023.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PAGE 12, PART XII, LINE 2C - AUDIT COMMITTEE OVERSIGHT PROCESS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THIS PROCESS IS CONSISTENT WITH THE PRIOR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PAGES 7 & 8, PART VII & FORM 990, PAGE 10, PART IX, LINE 5
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REPORTED SALARY EXPENSE - THIS FILING ENTITY ISSUES ALL W-2S FOR THE OFFICERS LISTED, BUT A RELATED ENTITY RECORDS AND REPORTS A PORTION OF SALARY EXPENSE OF SOME OFFICERS.
